description: a(n) = Sum_{k = 1..10^n} d(k) where d(n) = number of divisors of n (A000005).
comments: The Polymath project describes an algorithm for computing a(n) in time O(2.154...^n), see Tao, Croot, and Helfgott link. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Apr 16 2012
links: Hiroaki Yamanouchi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..27
Terence Tao, Ernest Croot III, and Harald Helfgott, Deterministic methods to find primes, Mathematics of Computation, 81 (2012), 1233-1246. arXiv:1009.3956, [math.NT], 2010-2012.
mathematica: k = s = 0; Do[ While[ k < 10^n, k++; s = s + DivisorSigma[ 0, k ] ]; Print[s], {n, 0, 8} ]
author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Sep 21 2000
